text: Patrick Anthony Jennings (born 12 June 1945'New Year Honours: Pat Jennings 'absolutely delighted' with CBE'. BBC News, 30 December 2022, accessed 30 December 2022) is a Northern Irish former footballer. He played as a goalkeeper. He played 119 international matches for Northern Ireland. His international career lasted for over 22 years. During his career, Jennings played for Newry Town and Watford. He also played in the top division with Tottenham Hotspur and Arsenal. He won the FA Cup with both of these teams. In total, Jennings made over 1,000 top level appearances. Even though he was a goalkeeper, he scored in the 1967 FA Charity Shield. Jennings was born in Newry. He won his last cap at the age of 41. == Honours == ===International=== *British Home Championship 1979–80 & 1983-4 === Club === Tottenham Hotspur *FA Cup: 1966–67 *League Cup: 1970–71, 1972–73 *FA Charity Shield: 1967 *UEFA Cup: 1971–72 Arsenal *FA Cup: 1978–79 === Individual === * Rothmans Golden Boots Awards: 1973, 1974 * FWA Footballer of the Year: 1972–73 * PFA Players' Player of the Year: 1975–76 * PFA First Division Team of the Year: 1973–74, 1975–76 * World XI: 1973 * FWA Tribute Award: 1986 * Football League 100 Legends: 1998 * English Football Hall of Fame: 2003 ==References== Category:1945 births Category:Living people Category:British association football goalkeepers Category:People from County Down Category:Arsenal F.C. players Category:Tottenham Hotspur F.C. players Category:Watford F.C. players Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:1982 FIFA World Cup players Category:1986 FIFA World Cup players
title: Pat Jennings
